summary.text: Requires the retired pay of an officer who has been credited by the Secretary of the military department concerned with extraordinary heroism in the line of duty to be increased by ten percent (but to no more than 75 percent of the retired pay base upon which the retired pay computation is based). Requires such increase with respect to: (1) officer non-regular service; (2) retired pay for officers who first became members of the armed forces after September 7, 1980; (3) voluntary officer retirements; and (4) officer retired pay recomputed due to later active duty.

bill.title: To amend titles 10 and 14, United States Code, to provide for an increase in military retired pay for officers by reason of being credited with extraordinary heroism on the same basis as applies to enlisted members.

dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
